doc.after: An echocardiogram can within certain limits produce an accurate assessment of the direction of blood flow and the velocity of blood and cardiac tissue at any arbitrary point using the Doppler effect One of the limitations is that the ultrasound beam should be as parallel to the blood flow as possible Velocity measurements allow assessment of cardiac valve areas and function any abnormal communications between the left and right side of the heart any leaking of blood through the valves valvular regurgitation and calculation of the cardiac output Contrast enhanced ultrasound using gas filled microbubble contrast media can be used to improve velocity or other flow related medical measurements
